block.p: She always tries to do at least one play a season about the water, ''an ocean, a river, something,'' said Gayle Stahlhuth, artistic director of the East Lynne Theater Company in Cape May. This year it's Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, ''Anna Christie,'' about a bitter Midwestern woman who joins her sea captain father in the Northeast. The play's stars are Katherine Puma and Kevin Mahoney (in photo, right).

She always tries to do at least one play a season about the water, ''an ocean, a river, something,'' said Gayle Stahlhuth, artistic director of the East Lynne Theater Company in Cape May. This year it's Eugene O'Neill's Pulitzer Prize-winning play, ''Anna Christie,'' about a bitter Midwestern woman who joins her sea captain father in the Northeast. The play's stars are Katherine Puma and Kevin Mahoney (in photo, right).

The 1930 film version was Garbo's first talkie: her opening lines: ''Gimme a whiskey, ginger ale on the side. And don't be stingy, baby.'' The play had its first out-of-town tryout in Atlantic City. Ms. Stahlhuth, who adores the ocean, was born in Indiana. ''I started crawling east when I was a baby,'' she said. Through July 16; (609)884-5898.
